page.title: 05Transport South of Oakley 2
page.content:
The area of South Oakley and Pardown are served by the{National Bus Company with a route to and from Basingstoke Bus Terminus. These are usually two buses per hour with three at the peak times when people are travelling to and from work (0800 to 0900 and 1700 to 1800).
The{London/Southampton railway}passes through the area but due to the fact that there is no local railway station it serves only to act as a barrier to road and foot transport which are limited to crossing by the bridges.
{Helicopters}from nearby R.A.F. Odiham cross the area daily and create noise which is a cause for complaint by local residents.
